content: Me gusta que los ejemplos sean como de trabajos reales, esto te da una idea de lo que puedes llegar a hacer sabiendo programar. Mi feedback es que en los Projects no ayuden tanto y que en los Challenges ( que si son mas dificiles) ponga alguna opcion que te vaya dando pistas de poco a poco.

Recent update just included essential web-dev topics (like flexbox, css grid). Challenges are still not really challenging though. Still no dark mode. Sololearn community challenges are much better. Ohh and Google's Grasshopper is amaazing for JS.

UPDATED: from 1 star to 3 stars because its easy and fun to use, and the material has been slightly improved recently by adding challenging content. I don't see the point of having a suggestion thread when they don't add highly voted suggestions such as Dark mode etc. Looks like the developers are only making the app to work or look based on their own ideas and not what the users really want. Challenges can be very repetitive. A subscription doesn't really give you more content.

Worthless app, absolutely disgusting paywall, you want ro learn anything behind variables and cobsole output, you pay. Challenges are also paid. Deleted after 5 minutes of using it. Too greedy model. Sololearn however will get my money since they are not as greedy and let me try all content before paying.
Very informative, motivating, I completed a lot of coding tasks using this app. Need to bring back the Daily Challenges with more competitive codings.I like that feature.
Im having a great experience with this app, but im running into a new problem with the Challenges section as its not letting me complete one with 3 different outcomes even when i get one right.
Challenges your logical thinking by using easy and straightforward ways to teach you a certain topic of a lesson.
